intro: Taraxacum proximum var. detonsum, commonly known as the detonsum dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features basal, spoon-shaped leaves with a hairy surface and a milky sap that is characteristic of the genus Taraxacum. Its flowers are typically yellow, consisting of a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it produces a fluffy seed head that aids in wind pollination. This variant is notable for its geographic distribution and ecological adaptations to its native habitats.
